section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Clubs (Safety of Premises) (Appeal Board) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: appellant (上訴人) means a person who lodges a notice of appeal under section 13 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notice of appeal
section.leadIn: Notice of appeal under section 13 of the Ordinance shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Form 1 in the Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lodged by the appellant with the Chairman.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Appellant to serve copy of notice of appeal and statement of particulars
section.content: When lodging a notice of appeal under section 13 of the Ordinance, the appellant shall at the same time serve a copy of such notice on the Secretary and shall furnish to the Secretary and the Chairman a statement specifying the grounds of the appeal and including such particulars of the evidence to be adduced, documents to be produced, names of witnesses to be called as may suffice to ensure that the Appeal Board and the Secretary are fully and fairly informed of the grounds of the appeal.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Further particulars
section.content: If any party to any appeal requires further particulars from the other party relating to the appeal, he may within 7 days after the service on the Secretary of a copy of the notice of appeal under regulation 4 or such longer period as the Chairman, on application, may allow in any particular case, serve notice on the other party specifying the further particulars required, and the other party shall within 7 days after notice is served under this regulation or such longer period as the Chairman, on application, may allow in any particular case, furnish such particulars to the other party and lodge a copy of such particulars with the Chairman.

subsection.content: Any party to any appeal may at any time serve notice on the other party to produce, within 7 days after the notice is served, any document relating to the appeal for the inspection of the party serving the notice and to permit him to take copies thereof.

Any party who fails to comply with a notice under subregulation (1) shall not afterwards be allowed to put any such document in evidence unless he satisfies the Appeal Board that he had a reason for his failure to comply which the Appeal Board deems sufficient.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Date, time and place of hearing
section.content: Where notice of appeal is lodged, the Chairman shall fix the date, time and place of the hearing of appeal so as to enable the hearing to commence as soon as is reasonably practicable and shall, not less than 28 days before the date so fixed, serve on the appellant and on the Secretary notice of the date, time and place in Form 2 in the Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Summons to witness
section.content: Upon application by any party to any appeal in Form 3 in the Schedule, the Chairman may issue a witness summons in Form 4 in the Schedule to any person named in the application requiring him to appear before the Appeal Board to produce any document relating to the appeal and to give evidence.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Appeal to be conducted in public
section.content: The hearing of the appeal shall be conducted in public unless the Chairman of his own motion, or at the request of the appellant or the Secretary, orders that all or any persons should be excluded from the whole or any part of the hearing.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Representation
section.leadIn: At the hearing of the appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant may be represented by a barrister or solicitor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary may be represented by a barrister or solicitor, including a legal officer.

subsection.content: The appellant may abandon the whole or any part of the appeal by notice in writing lodged with the Chairman.
When lodging a notice under subregulation (1), the appellant shall at the same time serve a copy of such notice on the Secretary.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Failure of appellant to attend hearing

subsection.leadIn: If on the day and time fixed for the hearing of the appeal the appellant fails to attend the hearing either in person or by a barrister or solicitor, the Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if satisfied that the appellant’s failure to attend was due to sickness or other reasonable cause, postpone or adjourn the hearing for such period as it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to hear the appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal.

subsection.content: Where the appeal is dismissed by the Appeal Board under subregulation (1)(c) the appellant may, within 30 days after the making of the order for dismissal, by notice in writing lodged with the Chairman, apply to the Appeal Board to review its order and the Appeal Board may, if satisfied that the appellant’s failure to attend the hearing was due to sickness or any other reasonable cause, set aside the order for dismissal.
When lodging a notice under subregulation (2), the appellant shall at the same time serve a copy of such notice on the Secretary.

Where the Appeal Board sets aside an order for dismissal under subregulation (2), the Chairman shall fix the date, time and place for the hearing of the appeal so as to enable the hearing to commence as soon as is reasonably practicable and shall, not less than 14 days before the date so fixed, serve on the appellant and on the Secretary notice of the date, time and place in Form 2 in the Schedule.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Failure of appellant to serve notice of appeal on the Secretary or to furnish particulars
section.leadIn: Where an Appeal Board is satisfied that the appellant has failed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to serve a copy of the notice of appeal on the Secretary under regulation 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to furnish a statement of particulars to the Secretary and the Chairman under regulation 4; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to furnish further particulars to the Secretary under regulation 5,

section.continued: the Appeal Board may dismiss the appeal.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Record of proceedings
section.leadIn: The Chairman shall take or cause to be taken in writing a full minute, so far as circumstances permit, of the following matters in respect of every appeal heard by the Appeal Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds of the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the appellant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of any person who appears as a witness for the appellant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of any person who appears as a witness for the Secretary;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name of any person summoned as a witness before the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the evidence of any person who gives evidence;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the decision of the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the amount of any sum awarded under section 15 of the Ordinance in respect of the costs involved in the appeal; and the name of the person in favour of whom the award was made.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Service of notices by Chairman, Secretary or appellant
section.leadIn: Any notice required to be served under these regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Chairman on the appellant or the Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the Secretary on the appellant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the appellant on the Secretary,

section.continued: may be served by serving a copy personally or by registered post addressed to the last known address of the appellant or of the Secretary, as the case may be.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.text: Clubs (Safety of Premises) Ordinance(Chapter 376)NOTICE OF APPEAL UNDER SECTION 13

p.b: Before completing this form read the note below.

td.p: To: The Chairman of the Appeal Board

tr.td: Address of Appellant or name and address of duly authorized representative for service if different from the above:

Details of notice appealed against:
(Attach a copy of the decision and indicate the particular aspect being the subject of the appeal)
This form is to be used by a person who is aggrieved by a decision of the Secretary under section 6, 8, 9 or 10 of the Ordinance.

This form must be completed in accordance with the directions specified in the form and lodged with the Chairman of the Appeal Board at the office of the Registrar, High Court before the expiry of 28 days after the service upon you of notice from the Secretary in respect of the decision you wish to appeal against.

At the same time that this notice is lodged you are required to serve a copy of the notice on the Secretary, personally, or by registered post addressed to the last known address of the Secretary and to furnish to the Secretary and the Chairman a statement specifying the particulars of the appeal which you seek to establish, including such particulars of evidence to be adduced, documents to be produced, names of witnesses to be called and other circumstances as may suffice to ensure that the Appeal Board and the Secretary are fully and fairly informed of the grounds on which the appeal is based. You may also be required to furnish further particulars or produce documents for the inspection of the Secretary.
You are advised to read the Clubs (Safety of Premises) Ordinance (Cap. 376) and the Clubs (Safety of Premises) (Appeal Board) Regulations (Cap. 376 sub. leg. A) before lodging this notice of appeal.
